poem:
**Election Notes**

In the hum of machinery,  
a nation's pulse quickens—  
whispers of ballots, silent,  
but oh, how they speak.  

The garbageman's antics,  
trinkets of distraction,  
while in unseen hands,  
the power dwells quietly,  
unfolding futures like  
delicate paper cranes,  
as the path to tomorrow  
etches itself in ink.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US elections live: Harris addresses first-time voters as Trump performs ‘garbageman’ stunt – as it happened 2.20am GMT Closing summary This blog is closing now – thanks for following along. Here’s a summary of day: More than 57.5 million people have already voted in US election. With six days until the 2024 election, more than 57.5 million Americans have already voted as of Wednesday afternoon, according to the Election Lab at the University of Florida.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: US elections live: Harris addresses first-time voters as Trump performs ‘garbageman’ stunt – as it happened 2.20am GMT Closing summary This blog is closing now – thanks for following along. Here’s a summary of day: More than 57.5 million people have already voted in US election. With six days until the 2024 election, more than 57.5 million Americans have already voted as of Wednesday afternoon, according to the Election Lab at the University of Florida.
